body.p: In the measurement chapter, the term ‘value’ is used to refer in general terms to an economic value of an asset or liability, rather than its carrying amount (see paragraph 5.1) and rather than a specific current value such as fair value. That term is used, for example, when that economic value may differ from the amount of a future cash payment or future cash receipt, for example, because of factors such as the time value of money.
